org.deidentifier.arx.masking

Class GenerateRandomDateMasker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractDictionaryMasker<T>
      • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractInstBasedDictMasker<T>
        • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractReplaceInstMasker<java.util.Date>
          • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.GenerateRandomDateMasker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDictionaryMasker<java.util.Date>, IInstanceMasker<java.util.Date>

    public class GenerateRandomDateMasker
extends AbstractReplaceInstMasker<java.util.Date>
    A masker that generates random dates using a given probability distribution and base date.

    For date generation, a random integer is sampled from the distribution and is then optionally shifted by a constant value. The random value is multiplied with the base period (usually a day) to obtain a perturbation period. Finally, this random time period is added to the given base date.

    Example:

     // Creating a masker that generates a random day in the year 2000:
 
 DateTime startOf2000 = new DateTime(2000, 1, 1, 0, 0);  // = 1 January 2000 0:00
 Days daysIn2000 = Days.daysBetween(startOf2000, startOf2000.plusYears(1)); // = 366; 2000 is a leap year.
 
 UniformIntegerDistribution distribution =
        new UniformIntegerDistribution(0, daysIn2000.getDays() - 1);    // Samples from [0; 365].
 
 GenerateRandomDateMasker masker =
        new GenerateRandomDateMasker(distribution, startOf2000, Days.ONE);

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenerateRandomDateMasker

        public GenerateRandomDateMasker(org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.IntegerDistribution distribution,
                        org.joda.time.ReadableDateTime baseDate)
        Creates a new random date masker based on the amount of days sampled from the given distribution and added to the given base date.
        Parameters:
        distribution - The probability distribution providing random amounts of days.
        baseDate - The date to which the sampled amount of days is added.

      • GenerateRandomDateMasker

        public GenerateRandomDateMasker(org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.IntegerDistribution distribution,
                        org.joda.time.ReadableDateTime baseDate,
                        org.joda.time.ReadablePeriod basePeriod)
        Creates a new random date masker using the given distribution and base date. Integers sampled from the distribution are multiplied with the base period and then added to the base date.
        Parameters:
        distribution - The probability distribution providing random integers.
        baseDate - The date to which the random amount of base periods is added.
        basePeriod - The period of time that is multiplied by a random integer to generate the shift period.

      • GenerateRandomDateMasker

        public GenerateRandomDateMasker(org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.IntegerDistribution distribution,
                        int shiftConstant,
                        org.joda.time.ReadableDateTime baseDate)
        Creates a new random date masker based on the amount of days sampled from the given distribution and added to the given base date. As a basic modification to the distribution, a shift constant can be added to the sampled days.
        Parameters:
        distribution - The probability distribution providing random amounts of days.
        shiftConstant - The constant shift applied to the distribution.
        baseDate - The date to which the sampled amount of days is added.

      • GenerateRandomDateMasker

        public GenerateRandomDateMasker(org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.IntegerDistribution distribution,
                        int shiftConstant,
                        org.joda.time.ReadableDateTime baseDate,
                        org.joda.time.ReadablePeriod basePeriod)
        Creates a new random date masker using the given distribution and base date. Integers sampled from the distribution are multiplied with the base period and then added to the base date. As a basic modification to the distribution, a shift constant can be added to the sampled integers.
        Parameters:
        distribution - The probability distribution providing random integers.
        shiftConstant - The constant shift applied to the distribution.
        baseDate - The date to which the random amount of base periods is added.
        basePeriod - The period of time that is multiplied by a random integer to generate the shift period.
